CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 7, 1938, pg. 13, reads: "Real Fellows! - Left to right, the ever popular and handsome Cab Calloway, Light-heavyweight Champ, John Henry Lewis, Joe Louis and Freddie Guinyard of Joe's camp pictured at Loendi Club where they had a 'ball.'"Cutline of image published in Flash Newspicture Magazine, May 17, 1938, pg. 26, reads: "A quartet of celebrities in Pittsburgh, one of the leading sportsmen in the East, William 'Woogie' Harris of Pittsburgh, Cabell 'Cab' Calloway celebrated Cotton Club orchestra leader, John Henry Lewis, the world's light-heavyweight champion, and Joe Louis, the world's heavyweight champion at the party held at the Loendi Club after the Fashion Parade. (Pgh. Photos by 'Teenie' Harris)."
TitMainTitle: William "Woogie" Harris, Cab Calloway, John Henry Lewis, and Joe Louis, with Geraldine or Philistine Bobo at left, in Loendi Club
